whyClientsChoose.name: Why Clients Choose Korn Ferry
whyClientsChoose.description: Themes explaining the positive selection criteria and differentiators clients cite for choosing Korn Ferry over competitors across NPS interviews (primarily executive/professional search, with some consulting references).

themes.label: Trusted relationships and continuity
themes.description: Clients choose Korn Ferry because long-standing personal relationships and continuity with specific consultants create trust, confidence, and ease of working—often outweighing competitive pitches.

supportingQuotes.text: “I've been dealing with Korn Ferry... they've now placed me... so I've known them for probably two... maybe even three decades.”
“They know me, and they know Carilion Clinic exceptionally well... that creates efficiency, alignment, and so far, a lot of success.”
“Part of it is indeed the trust I have in Olivier Top as a consultant.”
“For me, Korn Ferry is the go-to for executive search... Jerry's very good at relationship management... Always informed, always acts quickly.”
“It's definitely a personal relationship with the people... I've had good results.”
“We just hit it off... I trust him with my business... Anywhere Chris went, I would go.”

themes.label: High-calibre candidate delivery
themes.description: Korn Ferry is selected for its ability to access, attract, and present high-quality candidate slates—often providing credible options and strong fit even for niche or senior roles.

supportingQuotes.text: “It was just really, really good... really high calibre people.”
“It's been superb... we've upgraded our talent pool with these searches.”
“Cargill ended up getting an awesome human being... and he's here, and he's great.”
“All three of them could do the job and match with our company culture... three excellent candidates on the same level.”
“They absolutely understood the brief... put a great long list together, managed the candidates really, really well.”
“They came up with a very good list of candidates... six, seven candidates that we all could have hired in the end.”

themes.label: Deep market and sector expertise
themes.description: Clients differentiate Korn Ferry by the consultants’ market knowledge, specialist credibility, and ability to shape roles and search strategy based on how the market actually works.

supportingQuotes.text: “As Anne's a CPA... she was really additive... ‘you're calling this X, this is how it looks in the market’... [it] opened up the pool of talent.”
“It was obvious that they were experts. They had command.”
“They're extremely well prepared... they're very knowledgeable in the market... it ends up being quite an impressive conversation.”
“We needed someone with deep roots within this particular branch of the market... that's why we used Korn Ferry.”
“She understands the healthcare business extremely well and she's really buttoned up on this.”
“Right from the onset, it was clear he had some subject matter expertise... a savvy and agility to understand higher education that was distinct.”

themes.label: Structured, end-to-end process ownership
themes.description: Korn Ferry is chosen for running a disciplined, end-to-end search process—briefing, materials, logistics, stakeholder management, and closing—reducing burden on internal teams.

supportingQuotes.text: “They do everything... outside of [offer/comp], they really do everything.”
“Comprehensive end-to-end delivery... not all search firms are as adept and thorough in doing all of those aspects.”
“Their admin support was excellent... all the logistical arrangements... first class, all the way through.”
“The M&A team had a PowerPoint... each week... profiles of every candidate... and a tracker... they laid all the groundwork.”
“They looked over about 100 applications... condensed that to 11... then 7... then 4... and that... was plenty.”
“We set up a timeline... we were on a schedule... everything moved.”

themes.label: Responsive, high-touch communication
themes.description: Clients select Korn Ferry because they feel kept in the loop through frequent, fast, and flexible communication—often described as accessible, proactive, and aligned to stakeholder schedules.

supportingQuotes.text: “We'll communicate at any time, any day... they're very responsive... timing in these searches is very important... Korn Ferry's been able to deliver on that.”
“Their communication was exemplary.”
“Rebecca and I... will text, we will call... weekends, late into the evening... all of them are super responsive.”
“Communication is always absolutely stand out... we never feel blindsided... constant flow of communication.”
“They were incredibly responsive.”
“They were always available for other queries... more ad hoc stuff.”

themes.label: Assessment and data-driven confidence
themes.description: Korn Ferry differentiates through assessments, structured evaluation, and data that increase decision confidence, support stakeholder alignment, and sometimes extend into onboarding/development.

supportingQuotes.text: “The psychometric testing piece was very detailed and very good reporting... that was really valuable.”
“There's also a model... ranking them... in the key competencies... so it's not just subjective... it's also factual.”
“That formal assessment review... was incredibly powerful... that's where we had the aha moment.”
“All of our successful... candidates are assessed by Korn Ferry... we get a great richness of data... [often] as a development tool for when they land.”
“They ran... a significant battery of tests for our internal candidate... we felt very confident that we had the right person.”
“We use their psychometric tools for assessment, and they were very, very good... used for a development plan.”

promoterExperience.name: The Promoter Experience
promoterExperience.description: Themes that characterise what NPS Promoters (9–10) value most about working with Korn Ferry—what creates exceptional experiences, strong satisfaction, and repeat engagement.

themes.label: Trusted partnership and continuity
themes.description: Promoters most value a relationship-led partnership built on trust, familiarity, and consistent consultant continuity that makes Korn Ferry a default choice for critical work.

supportingQuotes.text: When the need ultimately arises, yeah, you're going to go to people that you know and that you trust and believe that also, at the end of the day, can deliver.
They know me, and they know Carilion Clinic exceptionally well... we've developed a degree of psychological safety... enough trust to be completely honest with each other.
Part of it is indeed the trust I have in Olivier Top as a consultant.
It's definitely a personal relationship with the people... I've had good results.
We just hit it off... I trust him with my business... Anywhere Chris went, I would go.
Would I ever use these people again? I can't imagine not using them again.
Definitely no brainer... I wouldn't even benchmark.
I would pick [Jena] again in a second.

themes.label: High-calibre candidates and fit
themes.description: Promoters consistently praise Korn Ferry for delivering strong candidate slates—often multiple “hireable” finalists—well matched to role requirements and culture, including in niche or senior markets.

supportingQuotes.text: It was just really, really good... really high calibre people.
It's been superb... we've upgraded our talent pool with these searches, which is what my expectation was.
Cargill ended up getting an awesome human being... and he's here, and he's great.
All three of them could do the job and match with our company culture... I have never seen this... three excellent candidates on the same level.
They absolutely understood the brief... put a great long list together, managed the candidates really, really well.
They came up with a very good list of candidates... six, seven candidates that we all could have hired in the end.
We needed someone with deep roots... that's why we used Korn Ferry... they threw the net widely... and delivered on that.

themes.label: Responsive, high-touch communication
themes.description: Promoters highlight fast, accessible, and proactive communication (texts, quick turnarounds, regular cadence) that keeps stakeholders confident and decisions moving.

supportingQuotes.text: We'll communicate at any time, any day... they're very responsive... they're quick... timing in these searches is very important for me.
Their communication was exemplary... We met every week. I would text... regularly.
They were very client-oriented, very service-oriented, very reactive... I really felt like a client.
Jerry's very communicative... keeping us in the loop... updates on every call, and really moving the process along.
Rebecca and I... will text, we will call... weekends, late into the evening... all of them are super responsive.
Communication is always absolutely stand out... we never feel blindsided... it's a constant flow of communication.
We had one scheduled weekly call throughout the process... and they were always available for other queries.

themes.label: Consultative guidance and challenge
themes.description: Promoters value Korn Ferry as a thought partner that shapes the brief, brings realism and market insight, and constructively challenges assumptions to improve outcomes.

supportingQuotes.text: I had a list ready of what I was looking for, and they put some more realism into it... that's what I appreciated... the flexibility.
They were bold... it was obvious that they were experts. They had command.
Asking really great questions... not been afraid to challenge which I love... there's no such thing as one size fits all.
Dan really guided the strategy of the search as well, not just execution of it.
They pushed me... They force you into this 'what's really important' conversation.
We were also impressed with the strategic point of view... a broad look on how to shape a board... that's what set Korn Ferry apart.
It was always an open discussion... finding common grounds... 'If you want all of this, it's going to cost you way more.'

themes.label: End-to-end ownership and execution
themes.description: Promoters appreciate Korn Ferry taking full process ownership—tight project management, logistics, candidate management, and offer closure—making complex searches feel seamless.

supportingQuotes.text: They do everything... outside of [offer conversations], they really do everything.
They are absolutely key... from the get-go and through to the end... comp negotiation... references... informal checks.
Their admin support was excellent... all the logistical arrangements... it was just first class, all the way through.
We set up a timeline... we were on a schedule, we did Zoom calls, everything moved.
It was like really an easy way of interacting... to be efficient and to go forward... It was impeccable.
Everything was really easy... my life is a very complicated one... but it all worked fine.

themes.label: Credible assessments and data
themes.description: Promoters value Korn Ferry’s assessments, structured tools, and data as credibility-builders that improve decision quality, align stakeholders, and support onboarding/development.

supportingQuotes.text: There's also a model... ranking them... in the key competencies... so it's not just [subjective]... it's also factual.
All of our successful... candidates are assessed by Korn Ferry... we get a great richness of data... quite often [we use it as] a development tool for when they land.
The value is you're getting input from an entire board... the tools help understand the skill set... It's a good way to get everybody to offer feedback and input.
They ran some significant... battery of tests for our internal candidate... we felt very confident that we had the right person.
What was written in the report of the assessment was aligned with the person I had in front of me... their assessment system works well.
Yes, I use that tool. I find it very helpful.

whereFallsShort.name: Where the Experience Falls Short
whereFallsShort.description: Recurring pain points and gaps that reduce perceived value, confidence, and ease of working with Korn Ferry—most often raised by detractors and passives—spanning candidate quality/alignment, pace and proactivity, communication/coordination, compensation handling, and consistency of delivery.

themes.label: Candidate quality and fit gaps
themes.description: Clients reported shortlists that felt average, off-brief, or insufficiently differentiated—sometimes requiring the client to supply the eventual hire or rely on their own network.

supportingQuotes.text: “Some of the people on the shortlist had minimal experience... after five minutes, you knew they just were nowhere near what you wanted.”
“We've just paid 70 grand in fees for someone that we gave them.”
“It felt more like he was trying to get us bodies... we need two or three people... as good as our internal candidate, or better.”
“They didn't really generate the level of the candidates that we thought they should have... Two of the three finalists were my contacts.”
“We ended up getting quite junior people for a director-level role... [that wasn't] going to work for our organisation.”

themes.label: Slow pace and weak momentum
themes.description: Several interviews described a slow start, extended timelines, or a loss of momentum late-stage—creating stakeholder anxiety and sometimes contributing to missed hires.

supportingQuotes.text: “It just took way, way longer than we thought... the best part of five months, six months.”
“It was not quantity versus quality, but rather quality versus pace... it would have been better to just get...the first profile to work with.”
“At one stage... are we putting all our eggs in one basket...”
“I was not quite comfortable that we had a ready backup pool... keep interviews going until an offer is accepted... and the background checks been cleared.”
“It feels like it slows down considerably once two or three candidates are kind of at the top of the list.”
supportingQuotes.company: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Nebraska

supportingQuotes.text: “It got off to such a good start... and then it sort of skidded off the runway.”

themes.label: Communication and coordination friction
themes.description: Clients experienced misaligned communication preferences, slow responses, unclear points of contact, and scheduling/logistics errors that created avoidable effort and frustration.

supportingQuotes.text: “Sometimes it would be overnight... and on occasion, instead of just replying to an email, there was a request to have a conversation... I always don't have the luxury... to carve out those times.”
“Sometimes it took 30 hours or so... you have an email to three [people] so you would have thought at least one of them could just tell me... but [we got nothing].”
“The reports would often land an hour or two before the call... you have no hope in hell of getting to it.”
“They would always send the book out... two hours before the meeting... You just haven't got time to look at it.”
“Three of us come on to the call and nobody shows up... the guy pulled out... 15 minutes before... and no one told us.”
“My most important candidate got invited to a zoom interview with the other leading candidate.”
“Early on, it was a little confusing... several different people... reaching out.”

themes.label: Compensation guidance and offer confusion
themes.description: Multiple clients cited weak compensation discovery/benchmarking, slow back-and-forth to confirm candidate expectations, and unclear ownership of offer/negotiation steps.

supportingQuotes.text: “When it came to saying... let's negotiate. What does she expect? And the answer was, I don't know.”
“My view was that that initial offer and negotiation should come by the agency... But he felt that was our role, not his.”
“He brought us someone who... was well over a million dollars in salary, and he knew ours was like at 600, 700,000 total.”
“Trying to get out of them what current comp was, was impossible... it took forever to put an offer together.”
“We didn't get any support... we got a very blanket 'the expectation is around about half a million'.”
“We potentially dodged a bullet... I was not quite comfortable that we had a ready backup pool we'd be able to immediately bring in and continue the process.”

themes.label: Inconsistent delivery across teams
themes.description: Experience quality was reported to vary significantly by lead consultant/team, with weaker engagement, resourcing, or execution when the “A team” was not involved.

supportingQuotes.text: “It depends on the team that you're working with.”
“I didn't feel like I was working exactly with Korn Ferry... I'm not sure that's endemic of Korn Ferry... the junior research analyst was average at best.”
“Variation in experience and delivery style between teams.”
“We got the message... we have limited capacity, so now we are splitting up and working individually... it was not the same great experience as we had at the beginning.”
“Once she was gone, it felt less prioritised... it just felt a little bit... an ownership thing.”

themes.label: Partnership, governance, and value tension
themes.description: Some clients felt Korn Ferry did not operate as a true partner—bypassing agreed governance, “managing up” past the primary contact, being insufficiently proactive/solution-led, or creating fee/value friction when clients contributed candidates.

supportingQuotes.text: “It was almost an element of, this is really difficult... rather than try to find me a solution.”
“Twice when he went to [the Board Chair], he got time frames changed... and that not would not have happened had the internal group been able to have the conversation.”
“They're managing up... in a way that felt somewhat disrespectful to me and my role.”
“It just seemed... penny smart, pound foolish... That behavior would make me not want to work with them again.”
“We've just paid 70 grand in fees for someone that we gave them, which feels a bit of a stink.”
